name: What's It Like Flying WestJet During COVID-19?
description:
The aviation industry has changed drastically over the past several months, and Canada's airlines aren't immune to the effects of COVID-19.

As Canada's second largest airline, WestJet has had to make some serious adjustments in their service and their domestic schedules.

Having already flown with their 737 in this new climate, I wanted to get a sense of what it’s like to fly with regional subsidiary Encore, and with mainline WestJet's 787-9 Dreamliner, in these different times.

-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-=-

FLIGHT INFORMATION
Airline: WestJet Encore (WEN/WR)
Aircraft: De Havilland Canada Dash 8-400 (DH8D)
Flight Number: WS3531
Seat: 4D/F
Livery: Standard (2015)
Engines: 2x PWC PW150A 
Registration: C-GENV
Route: Montreal-Trudeau (YUL) - Toronto-Pearson (YYZ)
Callsign: ENCORE 3531
Runway used: 24L (YUL) - 06L (YYZ)
Flight time: 1h03m
Date filmed: June 2020

Airline: WestJet (WJA/WS)
Aircraft: Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner (B789)
Flight Number: WS669
Seat: 9K
Livery: New (2018)
Engines: 2x GEnx-1B
Registration: C-GURP
Route: Toronto-Pearson (YYZ) - Calgary (YYZ)
Callsign: WESTJET 669 HEAVY
Runway used: 06L (YYZ) - 17L (YYC)
Flight time: 3h21m
Date filmed: June 2020
